message:
[Action Options]
1) PICK <obj>, Only PICK if gripper is empty. PICK only the correct next item according to the recipe.
2) PUT <obj1> <obj2>. <obj1> can be one of the foods. <obj2> can be food, cutting_board, or table.
3) WAIT, do nothing.
Only one robot can PUT each round. You must PICK up an item before PUT. 
[Action Output Instruction]
Must first output 'EXECUTE
', then give exactly one action per robot, put each on a new line.
Example#1: 'EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT bread_slice1 cutting_board
NAME Dave ACTION PICK tomato
'
Example#2: 'EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
NAME Dave ACTION PUT cheese tomato
'

[History]
== Round#0 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, please PICK bread_slice1 again. I will WAIT this round.

PROCEED
[Dave]:
Alright, I will PICK bread_slice1 and you can WAIT.

PROCEED
[Chad]:
Chad:
Dave, please PUT bread_slice1 on the cutting_board. I will PICK tomato.

PROCEED
[Dave]:
EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK tomato
NAME Dave ACTION PICK bread_slice1
[Executed Action]
Chad: PICK tomato
Dave: PICK bread_slice1
== Round#1 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, please PUT bread_slice1 on the cutting_board. I will WAIT this round.

PROCEED
[Dave]:
Alright, I will PUT bread_slice1 on the cutting_board and you can WAIT.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
NAME Dave ACTION PUT bread_slice1 cutting_board
[Executed Action]
Chad: WAIT
Dave: PUT bread_slice1 cutting_board
== Round#2 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, please WAIT while I PUT the tomato on the bread_slice1. 

PROCEED
[Dave]:
Alright, I will WAIT while you PUT the tomato on the bread_slice1.

PROCEED
[Chad]:
EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT tomato bread_slice1
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Chad: PUT tomato bread_slice1
Dave: WAIT
== Round#3 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, please PICK cheese. I will PICK beef_patty.

PROCEED
[Dave]:
Alright, I will PICK cheese and you can PICK beef_patty.

PROCEED
[Chad]:
EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK beef_patty
NAME Dave ACTION PICK cheese
[Executed Action]
Chad: PICK beef_patty
Dave: PICK cheese
== Round#4 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, it seems I made a mistake. We need to put the cheese on the tomato first. Please PUT the cheese on the tomato while I WAIT.

PROCEED
[Dave]:
Alright, I will PUT the cheese on the tomato while you WAIT.

PROCEED
[Chad]:
EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
NAME Dave ACTION PUT cheese tomato
[Executed Action]
Chad: WAIT
Dave: PUT cheese tomato
== Round#5 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, please WAIT while I PUT the beef_patty on the cheese. 

PROCEED
[Dave]:
Alright, I will WAIT while you PUT the beef_patty on the cheese.

PROCEED
[Chad]:
EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PUT beef_patty cheese
NAME Dave ACTION WAIT
[Executed Action]
Chad: PUT beef_patty cheese
Dave: WAIT
== Round#6 ==
[Chat History]
[Chad]:
Dave, please PICK bread_slice2. I will WAIT this round.

PROCEED
[Dave]:
Alright, I will PICK bread_slice2 and you can WAIT.

PROCEED
[Chad]:
EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
NAME Dave ACTION PICK bread_slice2
[Executed Action]
Chad: WAIT
Dave: PICK bread_slice2
== Current Round ==


You are a robot Dave, collaborating with Chad to make a [beef_patty_sandwich].
Food items must be stacked following this order: bread_slice1, tomato, cheese, beef_patty, bread_slice2, where bread_slice1 must be PUT on cutting_board. 
You must stay on left side of the table! This means you can only PICK food from left side, and Chad can only PICK from the other side.
Only one robot can PUT at a time, so you must coordiate with Chad.

At the current round:
You can see these food items are on your reachable side:
bread_slice1: on cutting_board
bacon: on your side
cheese: atop tomato
tomato: atop bread_slice1
beef_patty: atop cheese
Your gripper is holding bread_slice2
Think step-by-step about the task and Chad's response. Carefully check and correct them if they made a mistake. 
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].
Respond very concisely but informatively, and do not repeat what others have said. Discuss with others to come up with the best plan.
Propose exactly one action for yourself at the **current** round, select from [Action Options].
End your response by either: 1) output PROCEED, if the plans require further discussion; 2) If everyone has made proposals and got approved, output the final plan, must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!
        

[Current Chat]
[Chad]:
Dave, please PUT bread_slice2 on the beef_patty. I will WAIT this round.

PROCEED
You are Dave, your response is:

Alright, I will PUT bread_slice2 on the beef_patty while you WAIT.

EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
NAME Dave ACTION PUT bread_slice2 beef_patty
